snippet: An eclectic exhibition of paintings is firmly grounded in the Hudson River School, a retroactive grouping of 19th-century painters that is often described as America’s first viable art movement.
abstract: Works of a number of Hudson River School artists are on display in exhibit On Hudson: Highlights from the Albany Institute of History and Art, at the Florence Griswold Museum (Metropolitan/Connecticut).
lead_paragraph: An eclectic exhibition of paintings is firmly grounded in the Hudson River School, a retroactive grouping of 19th-century painters that is often described as America’s first viable art movement.
